alert.note: Alert for Blair (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 01 at 4:55PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following county, Blair. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 454 PM EDT, emergency management reported flooding in the advisory area. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Altoona, Horseshoe Curve and Penn State Altoona. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
